info.description: Wpay APIs for payments and gifting

preferencesCustomer.description: Available preference settings for a customer

preferencesMerchant.description: Available preference settings for a merchant

primaryInstrumentId.description: The primary instrument that will be used by default for a payment if a specific instrument is not specified.  The primary instrument will be used for the balance of the payment after any specified secondary instruments are used first.

secondaryInstruments.description: Rules for the creation of a default set of secondary instruments to be used for a payment if a specific set is not specified.  Secondary instruments are used in order until the full amount of the payment has been paid.

enableSecondaryInstruments.description: Flag indicating whether secondary instruments are enabled or disabled.  If not present defaults to enabled.  Used to specifically disable secondary instruments without losing customer configure preferences.

order.description: The order that the secondary instruments will be used for a specific payment.

exclude.description: Array of instruments to exclude from the secondary instruments set.  Indicates that the set of secondary instruments should include all valid instruments excluding those in this list.

include.description: Array of instruments to specifically include in the secondary instruments set.  Indicates that the set of secondary instruments should start as empty and only include all valid instruments excluding those in this list.

preferenceGroup.description: A set of groups of key/value based preferences

additionalProperties.description: A group or category of preferences

allowedBins.description: The gift card bin numbers that are allowed for the relevant merchant. This does not indicate sub-bins, ie. exact gift card programs.

serviceStatus.description: This property indicates the status of the gift card service in the container.

pinAlwaysRequired.description: Flag to indicate if the pin is always required for gift card transactions.

giftCard.description: The presence of this object in the response indicates that a gift card is an allowed payment method and instrument in the container for the relevant merchant.

allowedNetworks.description: The allowed networks (schemes) for credit card transactions.

allowedTransactionTypes.description: The allowed transaction types for credit card transactions.

serviceStatus.description: This property indicates the status of the paypal service in the container.

payPal.description: The presence of this object in the response indicates that paypal is an allowed payment method and instrument in the container for the relevant merchant.

qrId.description: The ID of the QR code

referenceType.description: The type of ID held in referenceId

image.description: Base64 encoded PNG of the QR Code

basket.description: Information provided by the Merchant on the basket of items associated with the payment request.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions

label.description: Short label for the basket item

description.description: Longer description of the basket item

quantity.description: The number of units of the item in the basket if multiple is possible.  Is a number to accommodate items charged by weight or length

unitPrice.description: The unit price of the item.  May be positive or negative

unitMeasure.description: Optional display string for the measure of the unit

totalPrice.description: The total price of the item.  May be positive or negative

tags.description: Additional string/string key/value pairs for the item defined by the merchant

instrumentAllocation.description: An instrument used for this transaction

paymentInstrumentId.description: The ID of the payment instrument

paymentTransactionRef.description: The reference for the payment.  If a refund this is the reference to the transaction being refunded

status.description: The current status of the transactions

posPayload.description: Payload describing the specific POS system.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions.  Provided in a generic schema previous configured by the merchant

payload.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

merchantPayload.description: Payload provided by the merchant to support other types of messaging.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions.  Provided in a generic schema previous configured by the merchant

grossAmount.description: The gross amount to be paid.  Must be positive except for refunds

merchantPaymentSummary.description: Summary information for a single payment request

usesRemaining.description: The number of times that the payment request can be used to create a payment. If absent then request can be used an unlimited number of times

apiKeyParam.name: x-api-key
apiKeyParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the API key, if this endpoint is being called directly from a web browser based site/page using client side code (eg. via javascript using AJAX).

authKeyParam.name: a-auth-key
authKeyParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the base64 encoded API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server.

authDigestParam.name: x-auth-digest
authDigestParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the encrypted API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server. The API key is encrypted with the client secret key.

messageIdParam.name: x-message-id
messageIdParam.description: This id is used to keep track of the request and its response in the Digital Pay platform. If no value is provided for the request header, Apigee will auto generate an id to use for the request. This header will also be returned in the response and will have the value passed in OR generated for the request.

authorizationParam.name: authorization
authorizationParam.description: The access token is obtained from the auth/login endpoint after a user is authenticated. This token is a bearer token.

versionParam.name: x-v
versionParam.description: The version of the end point requested for this invocation.

contentTypeParam.name: content-type
contentTypeParam.description: The MIME type of the body of the request.

verifyPaymentInstrumentsRequest.description: The JSON request structure of the Verify Payment Instruments endpoint.

clientReference.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the transaction in the merchants system.

paymentToken.description: The payment token.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during payment, the payment for that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the payment. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is currently only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during payment.

responseFormat.description: The fraud check response message format.

fraudPayload.description: Set to null to skip the fraud check.

clientReference.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the transaction in the merchants system.

customerRef.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the customer in the merchants system.

orderNumber.description: The merchant order number of the transaction. This property is only required if the 'immediateCharge' property is true.

stateOrTerritory.description: The customer's abbreviated state or territory.

countryCode.description: The customer's Alpha-2 (2-character) ISO-3166-1 country code.

type.description: The payment agreement type.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment agreement payment instrument id that will be used for the charges.

startDate.description: The payment agreement start date and time. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

endDate.description: The payment agreement end date and time. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

chargeAmount.description: The amount that will be charged at the frequency specified in the payment agreement.

immediateCharge.description: A flag to indicate if a charge transaction must be performed at the time of payment agreement creation. This in convenient in the cases where a customer wants to process a first charge transaction immediately at payment agreement creation.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during validation, the validation of that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the API call. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during the API call.

responseFormat.description: The fraud check response message format.

fraudPayload.description: Set to null to skip the fraud check.

chargeAmount.description: The amount that will be charged at the frequency specified in the payment agreement.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during validation, the validation of that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the API call. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during the API call. Only required if the payment agreement payment instrument id is being changed to a different payment instrument.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument id from the card capture iframe response or the list payment instruments response. This property can be omitted if the payment token property is present.

paymentToken.description: The payment token from the card capture iframe response or the list payment instruments response. This property can be omitted if the payment instrument id property is present.

amount.description: The amount you want to pay with the payment instrument.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during payment, the payment for that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the payment. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is currently only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during payment.

passcode.description: The passcode is used to send additional information (eg. gift card PIN) for the payment instrument. This property is currently only required for gift card instruments and only if the gift card PIN is required during payment. This property should NOT be used with credit card instruments (see stepUpToken).

primaryInstrumentId.description: The Id of the primary instrument.  Will be used as the balance of the transaction.  If not present then the primary instrument from the customer preferences will be used.

secondaryInstruments.description: The secondary instruments (if any) used to partially make the payment.  If not present then the primary instrument from the customer preferences will be used.  To specify that no secondary instruments should be used an empty array should be provided.

items.description: An instrument used for this transaction

instrumentId.description: The ID of the payment instrument

amount.description: The amount to charged against this instrument.  Must be greater than zero

skipRollback.description: An optional flag allowing the consumer to indicate that automatic rollback step should be skipped in the case of failure

clientReference.description: An optional client reference to be associated with the transaction.  If not suplied the transactionId will be used.

specificWalletId.description: The ID of a specific wallet for which the payment is intended.  Can be used in scenarios where a customer has previously requested that their wallet ID is retained for repeat purchase.  If supplied the payment can only be used by the intended wallet.  If absent then any wallet can create a payment against the payment request
